title: How to Modify the Navigation System of an Acura

steps.title: Stop the car and turn on the navigation system.
steps.content: Stop the car and turn on the navigation system.

steps.title: Wait until you can see the main screen.
steps.content: Wait until you can see the main screen.

steps.title: Hold down the "MAP/GUIDE", "MENU", and "CANCEL" buttons about 3-5 seconds at the main screen.
steps.content: Hold down the "MAP/GUIDE", "MENU", and "CANCEL" buttons about 3-5 seconds at the main screen.

steps.title: Wait until the Selected Diagnosis Items screen comes up.
steps.content: Wait until the Selected Diagnosis Items screen comes up.

steps.title: Press the "Version" button on the screen by touching the screen.
steps.content: Press the "Version" button on the screen by touching the screen.

steps.title: When Version screen comes up, write down the filename next to the words "Loading FileName".
steps.content: When Version screen comes up, write down the filename next to the words "Loading FileName". (ex. BNHN404A.BIN)

steps.title: Get out of the car and open the trunk.
steps.content: Get out of the car and open the trunk.

steps.title: Find the DVD player that attached to the navigation system in the top of the trunk.
steps.content: Find the DVD player that attached to the navigation system in the top of the trunk. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the small front plate and eject the Navigation DVD-ROM.
steps.content: Open the small front plate and eject the Navigation DVD-ROM.

steps.title: Turn off the car and the navigation system.
steps.content: Turn off the car and the navigation system.

steps.title: Load the Navigation DVD-ROM on your PC.
steps.content: Load the Navigation DVD-ROM on your PC.

steps.title: Open up the DVD-ROM and you will see the 9 .BIN files.
steps.content: Open up the DVD-ROM and you will see the 9 .BIN files.

steps.title: Copy all 9 .BIN files onto the PC.
steps.content: Copy all 9 .BIN files onto the PC. This includes: BN2HH12C.BIN, BN2HH110.BIN, BN2HH120.BIN, BN2HHMLD.BIN, BN2HN12B.BIN, BN2HN18B.BIN, BN2HN380.BIN, BNHH401A.BIN, BNHN404A.BIN

steps.title: Open up the Dumpnavi program.
steps.content: Open up the Dumpnavi program. .

steps.title: Click the top “Browse” button on the program to get the Bootloader file.
steps.content: Click the top “Browse” button on the program to get the Bootloader file.

steps.title: When the open file comes up, go to where you copied 9 .BIN files and select the .BIN file that has same name as you wrote down on step 6 and click the “Open” button.
steps.content: When the open file comes up, go to where you copied 9 .BIN files and select the .BIN file that has same name as you wrote down on step 6 and click the “Open” button.

steps.title: Click the bottom “Browse” button on the program to get the Bitmap file.
steps.content: Click the bottom “Browse” button on the program to get the Bitmap file.

steps.title: When the open file comes up, select the Bitmap (Picture) file you wish to use as your background.
steps.content: When the open file comes up, select the Bitmap (Picture) file you wish to use as your background.

steps.title: Once you select the both Bootloader file and Bitmap file, click the “Modify” button.
steps.content: Once you select the both Bootloader file and Bitmap file, click the “Modify” button.

steps.title: Copy the modified .BIN file, including all other .BIN files (9 in total) and burn them onto the blank CD or DVD.
steps.content: Copy the modified .BIN file, including all other .BIN files (9 in total) and burn them onto the blank CD or DVD.

steps.title: Insert the Navigation DVD-ROM that you took out back into the DVD player in the trunk.
steps.content: Insert the Navigation DVD-ROM that you took out back into the DVD player in the trunk.

steps.title: Start the car and turn on the Navigation system.
steps.content: Start the car and turn on the Navigation system.

steps.title: Wait until the main screen shows up.
steps.content: Wait until the main screen shows up.

steps.title: Hold down "MAP/GUIDE", "MENU", and "CANCEL" for 3-5 seconds, just like step 3.
steps.content: Hold down "MAP/GUIDE", "MENU", and "CANCEL" for 3-5 seconds, just like step 3.

steps.title: Wait until the Selected Diagnosis Items screen comes up.
steps.content: Wait until the Selected Diagnosis Items screen comes up.

steps.title: Press the "Version" button on the screen by touching the screen, like step 5.
steps.content: Press the "Version" button on the screen by touching the screen, like step 5.

steps.title: When you see the Version screen, get out of the car and open up the trunk.
steps.content: When you see the Version screen, get out of the car and open up the trunk.

steps.title: Take the Navigation DVD-ROM out of the DVD player, and replace it with the CD or DVD you just created in step 20.
steps.content: Take the Navigation DVD-ROM out of the DVD player, and replace it with the CD or DVD you just created in step 20.

steps.title: Go back into the car.
steps.content: Go back into the car.

steps.title: Press the "Load Disc" button on the Version screen to load your modified .BIN file into the navigation system.
steps.content: Press the "Load Disc" button on the Version screen to load your modified .BIN file into the navigation system. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wait until it's completely done and it will then display an error message about can't read the Navigation DVD-ROM.
steps.content: Wait until it's completely done and it will then display an error message about can't read the Navigation DVD-ROM.

steps.title: Open up the trunk and eject your burned CD or DVD from the DVD player in the trunk and insert the original Navigation DVD-ROM.
steps.content: Open up the trunk and eject your burned CD or DVD from the DVD player in the trunk and insert the original Navigation DVD-ROM. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go back into the car and turn off the car.
steps.content: Go back into the car and turn off the car.

steps.title: Start the car and turn on the navigation system.
steps.content: Start the car and turn on the navigation system. Now you can see the new modified Acura navigation startup screen.
